column2: Sometimes people take tobacco out of a traditional cigar, cigarillo or filtered cigar and replace it with marijuana. This is sometimes called a “blunt”.  Have you ever smoked part or all of a traditional cigar, cigarillo or filtered cigar with marijuana in it?  (Remember all information you give to the PATH Study will be kept private.)

[Sometimes people take tobacco out of a traditional cigar, cigarillo or filtered cigar and replace it with marijuana. This is sometimes called a “blunt”.]  In the past 12 months, have you smoked part or all of a traditional cigar, cigarillo or filtered cigar with marijuana in it? [(Remember all information you give to the PATH Study will be kept private.)]
Now think about the past 12 months when you smoked traditional cigars, cigarillos or filtered cigars.  In the past 12 months, how often was any of the tobacco replaced with marijuana?
When was the last time you smoked a traditional cigar, cigarillo, or filtered cigar as a blunt, even one or two puffs?
column18: 2 = Not today but sometime in the past 7 days
column19: 3 = Not in the past 7 days but sometime in the past 30 days
column20: 4 = Not in the past 30 days but sometime in the past 6 months
column21: 5 = Not in the past 6 months but sometime in the past year

column2: In the past 30 days, on how many days did you smoke a traditional cigar, cigarillo, or filtered cigar as a blunt?
In the past 30 days, on how many days did you smoke a traditional cigar, cigarillo, or filtered cigar as a blunt?
In the past 30 days, on the days you smoked traditional cigars, cigarillos, or filtered cigars as blunts, how many traditional cigars, cigarillos, or filtered cigars did you smoke as a blunt per day?
